q: quiet during the financial crisis. And the facts lead to one conclusion... we didn't even know one-fifth of it. The disclosure has major implications, according to Senate Budget Committee member Bernie Sanders : After years of stonewalling by the Fed, the American people are finally learning the incredible and jaw-dropping details of the Fed's multi-trillion-dollar bailout of Wall Street and corporate America. As a result of this disclosure, other members of Congress and I will be taking a very extensive look at all aspects of how the Federal Reserve functions and how we can make our financial institutions more responsive to the needs of ordinary Americans and small businesses. The obvious: Banks were bailed out. back-to-back 3-pointers that gave the Pistons the lead for good and sent them to a 107-102 victory over the Golden State Kobe Bryants on Thursday night.`` That really hurt my feelings, that tip,'' Rasheed Wallace said. You can't let that frustrate you. I missed two point-blank foul shots. I'm upset at myself about that. You can't let that one thing get you down. That's what we did, just dug deep and came up with some stops down the stretch. Richard Hamilton scored 24 points and Allen Iverson added 23 as the Pistons won for the second straight Tim Hardawaye to open their four-game road trip after losing their first two games with Allen Iverson . joined the Defending Social Security Caucus newly organized by fellow Democratic Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont.`` Social Security has not contributed a dime to the debt or the deficit,'' he said, calling the program rock-solid for at least another 27 years. That was a reference to the moment when Social Security's trustees project that the system's trust fund-- financed by payroll taxes that are segregated from other federal levies-- will run out.

me. You're a pro. You're a hell of a lot better than others in this town.'' Howard Kurtz suspects that Donald Rumsfeld 's goal with this memoir is to leave readers with the same conclusion. But it contains few surprises and, after so many years of divisive debate, is unlikely to change many minds, writes Howard Kurtz .`` What is known is that he has in these 50 chapters marshaled his best defense; only history's final verdict remains unknown.'' of Evansville political science professor. If Mike Pence is to encounter any bumps at all, they could come early, as he shifts his focus from federal to state issues, Robert Dion said. In some cases, it can be an awkward transition, to go from being a lawmaker to an executive, and to go from the federal level to the state level. There's going to be that transition that might have a few hiccups to it, he said.`` But he's familiar with all the issues, he's an energetic campaigner, he's got solid conservative credentials, he knows how to raise money.''
